metadata.datasetName: Grade 8 Perimeter, Area, and Volume Questions
metadata.subject: Mathematics
metadata.curriculumAlignment: NZ Year 8 Mathematics Curriculum - Measurement and Geometry
metadata.curriculumSubtopic: Geometric measurement: perimeter, area, volume calculations with real-world applications

educational_alignment.learning_progression: Measurement and Geometry - Geometric Measurement Fluency
mathematical_practices: Area measurement techniques for various shapes

cognitive_complexity.easy: Basic perimeter, area, and volume calculations with standard formulas
cognitive_complexity.medium: Multi-step geometric problems and composite shape measurements
cognitive_complexity.hard: Complex missing dimension problems and advanced geometric reasoning

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle garden that is 8 metres long and 5 metres wide.
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2 × (length + width) = 2 × (8 + 5) = 2 × 13 = 26 metres
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle garden that is 8 metres long and 5 metres wide. Perimeter = 2 × (length + width) = 2 × (8 + 5) = 2 × 13 = 26 metres perimeter rectangle

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Find the perimeter of a triangle with sides measuring 7 cm, 9 cm, and 12 cm.
questions.explanation: To find the perimeter, we add all sides together: Perimeter = sum of all sides = 7 + 9 + 12 = 28 cm
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the perimeter of a triangle with sides measuring 7 cm, 9 cm, and 12 cm. To find the perimeter, we add all sides together: Perimeter = sum of all sides = 7 + 9 + 12 = 28 cm perimeter triangle

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: A swimming pool consists of a combined rectangular section (10m × 6m) and a semicircular section with radius 3m. Calculate the total perimeter of this composite shape.
questions.explanation: Rectangle perimeter = 2(10 + 6) = 32m, but subtract one width (6m) where circle attaches. Semicircle = πr = 3.14 × 3 = 9.42m. Total = 32 - 6 + 9.42 = 35.42m
questions.contentForEmbedding: A swimming pool consists of a combined rectangular section (10m × 6m) and a semicircular section with radius 3m. Calculate the total perimeter of this composite shape. Rectangle perimeter = 2(10 + 6) = 32m, but subtract one width (6m) where circle attaches. Semicircle = πr = 3.14 × 3 = 9.42m. Total = 32 - 6 + 9.42 = 35.42m perimeter composite

questions.question: A rectangle field has a perimeter of 84 metres. If the width is 18 metres, what is the unknown length?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width), so 84 = 2(length + 18). Therefore 42 = length + 18, so length = 24 metres
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A rectangle field has a perimeter of 84 metres. If the width is 18 metres, what is the unknown length? Perimeter = 2(length + width), so 84 = 2(length + 18). Therefore 42 = length + 18, so length = 24 metres perimeter missing-side

questions.question: A farmer needs to fence the perimeter of a rectangle paddock. Fencing costs $15 per metre. If the paddock is 25m by 18m, how much will the fencing cost?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(25 + 18) = 86 metres. Cost = 86 × $15 = $1290
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A farmer needs to fence the perimeter of a rectangle paddock. Fencing costs $15 per metre. If the paddock is 25m by 18m, how much will the fencing cost? Perimeter = 2(25 + 18) = 86 metres. Cost = 86 × $15 = $1290 perimeter real-world

questions.question: An isosceles triangle has a perimeter of 34 cm. If the two equal sides are each 12 cm long, what is the length of the base?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = side1 + side2 + base, so 34 = 12 + 12 + base. Therefore base = 34 - 24 = 10 cm
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: An isosceles triangle has a perimeter of 34 cm. If the two equal sides are each 12 cm long, what is the length of the base? Perimeter = side1 + side2 + base, so 34 = 12 + 12 + base. Therefore base = 34 - 24 = 10 cm perimeter missing-side

questions.question: Calculate the area of a rectangle classroom that is 12 metres long and 8 metres wide.
questions.explanation: Area = length × width = 12 × 8 = 96 m²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the area of a rectangle classroom that is 12 metres long and 8 metres wide. Area = length × width = 12 × 8 = 96 m² area rectangle

questions.question: A square playground has sides of 15 metres each. What is the area of the playground?
questions.explanation: Area of square = side × side = 15 × 15 = 225 m²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A square playground has sides of 15 metres each. What is the area of the playground? Area of square = side × side = 15 × 15 = 225 m² area square

questions.question: Find the area of a triangle with base 14 cm and height 9 cm.
questions.explanation: Area = ½ × base × height = ½ × 14 × 9 = 63 cm²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the area of a triangle with base 14 cm and height 9 cm. Area = ½ × base × height = ½ × 14 × 9 = 63 cm² area triangle

questions.question: Calculate the area of a circular garden with radius 5 metres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the area of a circular garden with radius 5 metres. Area = πr² = 3.14159 × 5² = 3.14159 × 25 = 78.54 m² area circle

questions.question: Find the area of a parallelogram with base 15 cm and height 8 cm.
questions.explanation: Area = base × height = 15 × 8 = 120 cm²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the area of a parallelogram with base 15 cm and height 8 cm. Area = base × height = 15 × 8 = 120 cm² area parallelogram

questions.question: A rectangle field has an area of 96 m². If the length is 12 m, what is the width?
questions.explanation: Area = length × width, so 96 = 12 × width. Therefore width = 96 ÷ 12 = 8 m
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A rectangle field has an area of 96 m². If the length is 12 m, what is the width? Area = length × width, so 96 = 12 × width. Therefore width = 96 ÷ 12 = 8 m area missing-dimension

questions.question: A triangular piece of land has a base of 40 metres and height of 25 metres. If land costs $120 per square metre, what is the total cost?
questions.explanation: Area = ½ × base × height = ½ × 40 × 25 = 500 m². Cost = 500 × $120 = $60,000
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A triangular piece of land has a base of 40 metres and height of 25 metres. If land costs $120 per square metre, what is the total cost? Area = ½ × base × height = ½ × 40 × 25 = 500 m². Cost = 500 × $120 = $60,000 area real-world

questions.question: Calculate the volume of a rectangular prism storage box that is 10 cm long, 6 cm wide, and 4 cm high.
questions.explanation: Volume = length × width × height = 10 × 6 × 4 = 240 cm³
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the volume of a rectangular prism storage box that is 10 cm long, 6 cm wide, and 4 cm high. Volume = length × width × height = 10 × 6 × 4 = 240 cm³ volume rectangular-prism

questions.question: Find the volume of a cube with sides measuring 7 cm each.
questions.explanation: Volume = side³ = 7³ = 7 × 7 × 7 = 343 cm³
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the volume of a cube with sides measuring 7 cm each. Volume = side³ = 7³ = 7 × 7 × 7 = 343 cm³ volume cube

questions.question: Calculate the volume of a cylinder water tank with radius 3 metres and height 8 metres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the volume of a cylinder water tank with radius 3 metres and height 8 metres. Volume = πr²h = 3.14159 × 3² × 8 = 3.14159 × 9 × 8 = 226.19 m³ volume cylinder

questions.question: Find the volume of a square pyramid with base side 6 cm and height 9 cm.
questions.explanation: Volume = ⅓ × base area × height = ⅓ × (6 × 6) × 9 = ⅓ × 36 × 9 = 108 cm³
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the volume of a square pyramid with base side 6 cm and height 9 cm. Volume = ⅓ × base area × height = ⅓ × (6 × 6) × 9 = ⅓ × 36 × 9 = 108 cm³ volume pyramid

questions.question: A rectangular container has a volume of 360 cm³. If the length is 12 cm and width is 6 cm, what is the height?
questions.explanation: Volume = length × width × height, so 360 = 12 × 6 × height. Therefore height = 360 ÷ (12 × 6) = 360 ÷ 72 = 5 cm
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A rectangular container has a volume of 360 cm³. If the length is 12 cm and width is 6 cm, what is the height? Volume = length × width × height, so 360 = 12 × 6 × height. Therefore height = 360 ÷ (12 × 6) = 360 ÷ 72 = 5 cm volume missing-dimension

questions.question: A swimming pool in the shape of a rectangular prism is 15m long, 8m wide, and 2m deep. How many litres of water are needed to fill it? (1 m³ = 1000 litres)
questions.explanation: Volume = 15 × 8 × 2 = 240 m³. Converting to litres: 240 × 1000 = 240,000 litres
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A swimming pool in the shape of a rectangular prism is 15m long, 8m wide, and 2m deep. How many litres of water are needed to fill it? (1 m³ = 1000 litres) Volume = 15 × 8 × 2 = 240 m³. Converting to litres: 240 × 1000 = 240,000 litres volume real-world

questions.question: A square has a perimeter of 48 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: For a square, perimeter = 4 × side length, so 48 = 4 × side. Therefore side = 48 ÷ 4 = 12 cm
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A square has a perimeter of 48 cm. What is the length of each side? For a square, perimeter = 4 × side length, so 48 = 4 × side. Therefore side = 48 ÷ 4 = 12 cm perimeter reverse-perimeter

questions.question: A circle has an area of 314 cm². What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr², so 314 = 3.14 × r². Therefore r² = 314 ÷ 3.14 = 100, so r = √100 = 10 cm
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A circle has an area of 314 cm². What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14) Area = πr², so 314 = 3.14 × r². Therefore r² = 314 ÷ 3.14 = 100, so r = √100 = 10 cm area reverse-area

questions.question: A cube has a volume of 125 cm³. What is the length of each edge?
questions.explanation: Volume = side³, so side³ = 125. Therefore side = ∛125 = 5 cm
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A cube has a volume of 125 cm³. What is the length of each edge? Volume = side³, so side³ = 125. Therefore side = ∛125 = 5 cm volume reverse-volume

questions.question: A composite shape consists of a rectangle (8m × ?m) and a triangle (base 8m, height 3m). If the total area is 56 m², what is the missing width of the rectangle?
questions.explanation: Triangle area = ½ × 8 × 3 = 12 m². Rectangle area = 56 - 12 = 44 m². Since rectangle area = 8 × width, then width = 44 ÷ 8 = 5.5 m
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A composite shape consists of a rectangle (8m × ?m) and a triangle (base 8m, height 3m). If the total area is 56 m², what is the missing width of the rectangle? Triangle area = ½ × 8 × 3 = 12 m². Rectangle area = 56 - 12 = 44 m². Since rectangle area = 8 × width, then width = 44 ÷ 8 = 5.5 m composite missing-dimensions

questions.question: A basketball court is 28 metres long and 15 metres wide. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area = length × width = 28 × 15 = 420 m²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A basketball court is 28 metres long and 15 metres wide. What is its area? Area = length × width = 28 × 15 = 420 m² quality age-appropriate

questions.question: Find the area of a rectangular garden plot measuring 4.5 metres by 3.2 metres.
questions.explanation: Area = length × width = 4.5 × 3.2 = 14.4 m²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the area of a rectangular garden plot measuring 4.5 metres by 3.2 metres. Area = length × width = 4.5 × 3.2 = 14.4 m² quality units

questions.question: Calculate the volume of a cylindrical can with diameter 8 cm and height 12 cm.
questions.explanation: Radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 8 ÷ 2 = 4 cm. Volume = πr²h = 3.14159 × 4² × 12 = 3.14159 × 16 × 12 = 603.19 cm³
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the volume of a cylindrical can with diameter 8 cm and height 12 cm. Radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 8 ÷ 2 = 4 cm. Volume = πr²h = 3.14159 × 4² × 12 = 3.14159 × 16 × 12 = 603.19 cm³ quality formulas

questions.question: A rectangular photo frame is 20 cm long and 15 cm wide. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2 × (length + width) = 2 × (20 + 15) = 2 × 35 = 70 cm
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A rectangular photo frame is 20 cm long and 15 cm wide. What is its perimeter? Perimeter = 2 × (length + width) = 2 × (20 + 15) = 2 × 35 = 70 cm quality curriculum-alignment

questions.question: Calculate the area of a square playground with sides of 12 metres each.
questions.explanation: Area = side² = 12² = 12 × 12 = 144 m²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the area of a square playground with sides of 12 metres each. Area = side² = 12² = 12 × 12 = 144 m² additional square-area

questions.question: Find the area of a trapezoid with parallel sides of 8 cm and 12 cm, and height 5 cm.
questions.explanation: Area = ½ × (sum of parallel sides) × height = ½ × (8 + 12) × 5 = ½ × 20 × 5 = 50 cm²
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Find the area of a trapezoid with parallel sides of 8 cm and 12 cm, and height 5 cm. Area = ½ × (sum of parallel sides) × height = ½ × (8 + 12) × 5 = ½ × 20 × 5 = 50 cm² additional trapezoid-area

questions.question: Calculate the volume of a cone with radius 6 cm and height 10 cm.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: Calculate the volume of a cone with radius 6 cm and height 10 cm. Volume = ⅓ × πr²h = ⅓ × 3.14159 × 6² × 10 = ⅓ × 3.14159 × 36 × 10 = 376.99 cm³ additional cone-volume

questions.question: A cylindrical water tank has a radius of 2 metres and height of 5 metres. How many litres of water can it hold? (1 m³ = 1000 litres)
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.contentForEmbedding: A cylindrical water tank has a radius of 2 metres and height of 5 metres. How many litres of water can it hold? (1 m³ = 1000 litres) Volume = πr²h = 3.14159 × 2² × 5 = 3.14159 × 4 × 5 = 62.832 m³. Converting: 62.832 × 1000 = 62,832 litres additional practical-application
